name: CKEDITOR.plugins.codesnippet.highlighter
doc:
A Code Snippet highlighter. It can be set as a default highlighter using CKEDITOR.plugins.codesnippet.setHighlighter, for example:

// Create a new plugin which registers a custom code highlighter
// based on customEngine in order to replace the one that comes
// with the Code Snippet plugin.
CKEDITOR.plugins.add( 'myCustomHighlighter', {
    afterInit: function( editor ) {
        // Create a new instance of the highlighter.
        var myHighlighter = new CKEDITOR.plugins.codesnippet.highlighter( {
            init: function( ready ) {
                // Asynchronous code to load resources and libraries for customEngine.
                customEngine.loadResources( function() {
                    // Let the editor know that everything is ready.
                    ready();
                } );
            },
            highlighter: function( code, language, callback ) {
                // Let the customEngine highlight the code.
                customEngine.highlight( code, language, function() {
                    callback( highlightedCode );
                } );
            }
        } );

        // Check how it performs.
        myHighlighter.highlight( 'foo()', 'javascript', function( highlightedCode ) {
            console.log( highlightedCode ); // -> <span class="pretty">foo()</span>
        } );

        // From now on, myHighlighter will be used as a Code Snippet
        // highlighter, overwriting the default engine.
        editor.plugins.codesnippet.setHighlighter( myHighlighter );
    }
} );

params.name: def
params.doc: Highlighter definition. See highlighter, init and languages.

members.name: highlighter
members.doc: A function which highlights given plain text code in a given language and, once done, calls the callback function with highlighted markup as an argument.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Function which accepts highlighted String as an argument.

members.short_doc:
A function which highlights given plain text code in a given language and, once done,
calls the callback function wit...

members.name: init
members.doc: If specified, this function should asynchronously load highlighter-specific resources and execute ready when the highlighter is ready.

params.name: ready
params.doc: The function to be called once the highlighter is ready.

members.short_doc:
If specified, this function should asynchronously load highlighter-specific
resources and execute ready when the high...

members.name: languages
members.doc:
Defines languages supported by the highlighter. They can be restricted with the CKEDITOR.config.codeSnippet_languages configuration option.

Note: If CKEDITOR.config.codeSnippet_languages is set, it will overwrite the languages listed in languages.

languages: {
    coffeescript: 'CoffeeScript',
    cpp: 'C++',
    cs: 'C#',
    css: 'CSS'
}

More information on how to change the list of languages is available in the Code Snippet documentation.
members.short_doc: Defines languages supported by the highlighter. ...

members.name: queue
members.doc: A queue of highlight jobs to be done once the highlighter is ready.
members.short_doc:
A queue of highlight jobs to be
done once the highlighter is ready. ...

members.name: ready
members.doc: A flag which indicates whether the highlighter is ready to do jobs from the queue.

members.name: highlight
members.doc: Executes the highlighter. If the highlighter is not ready, it defers the job (queue) and executes it when the highlighter is ready.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Function which accepts highlighted String as an argument.

members.name: setHighlighter
members.doc: Sets the custom syntax highlighter. See CKEDITOR.plugins.codesnippet.highlighter to learn how to register a custom highlighter.
